trans-unit.source: Encapsulates a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> controls for use by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar"></xref> class.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection> is a zero-based indexed collection used by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar> class to hold all the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> controls assigned to the toolbar.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Add%2A> method to add individual buttons and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Remove%2A> method to delete them.
Call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Clear%2A> method to remove all the buttons from the collection.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection"></xref> class and assigns it to the specified toolbar.
You do not typically create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection> and explicitly call its constructor.

By referencing the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.Buttons%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar> control, a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection> is created.
You can then gain access to its properties and methods, and assign <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> controls to the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar"></xref> that is the parent of the collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> controls.
Adds a new toolbar button to the end of the toolbar button collection with the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton.Text"></xref> property value.

You can also add new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> objects to the collection by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.AddRange%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Insert%2A> methods, or the other version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Add%2A> method.

To remove a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> that you have previously added, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Remove%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.RemoveAt%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Clear%2A> methods.
The text to display on the new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref>.
The zero-based index value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> added to the collection.
Adds the specified toolbar button to the end of the toolbar button collection.

You can also add new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> objects to the collection by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.AddRange%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Insert%2A> methods, or the other version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Add%2A> method.

To remove a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> that you have previously added, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Remove%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.RemoveAt%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Clear%2A> methods.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> to be added after all existing buttons.
The zero-based index value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> added to the collection.
Adds a collection of toolbar buttons to this toolbar button collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> objects contained in the `nodes` array are appended to the end of the collection.

You can use method to quickly add a group of previously created <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> objects to the collection instead of manually adding each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> to the collection using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Add%2A> method.

To remove a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> that you have previously added, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Remove%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.RemoveAt%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Clear%2A> methods.
The collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> controls to add to this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection"></xref> contained in an array.
Removes all buttons from the toolbar button collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Clear%2A> method iterates through the collection and removes all toolbar buttons assigned to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection>.

To remove an individual toolbar button from the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Remove%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.RemoveAt%2A> methods.

To add new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> objects to the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.AddRange%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Insert%2A> methods.
Determines if the specified toolbar button is a member of the collection.

This method enables you to determine whether a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> is member of the collection before attempting to perform operations on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton>.
You can use this method to confirm that a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> has been added to or is still a member of the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> to locate in the collection.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> is a member of the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Determines if a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> with the specified key is contained in the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection>.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Item%2A> returns `false.`
The name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> to search for.
`true` to indicate a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> with the specified key is found; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the number of buttons in the toolbar button collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Count%2A> property holds the actual number of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> controls assigned to the collection.
It is common to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Count%2A> property value as the upper bounds of a loop to iterate through a collection.
The index value of a collection is a zero-based index, so you must subtract one from the looping variable otherwise you will exceed the upper bounds of the collection and throw an exception.
The number of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> controls assigned to the toolbar.
Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the toolbar button collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that represents the tree node collection.
Retrieves the index of the specified toolbar button in the collection.
This method gives you easy access to the index value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> in the collection.
The index value allows you to easily determine which <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> was clicked on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> clicked can be determined by evaluating the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.IndexOf%2A> value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButtonClickEventArgs.Button%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> to locate in the collection.
The zero-based index of the item found in the collection; otherwise, -1.
Retrieves the index of the first occurrence of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> with the specified key.

If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> is called successively, the last returned index will be checked for a key match first, and if there is no match, the search starts at the beginning of the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection>.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Item%2A> returns -1.
The name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> to search for.
The index of the first occurrence of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> with the specified key, if found; otherwise, -1.
Inserts an existing toolbar button in the toolbar button collection at the specified location.

You can also add new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> objects to the collection by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Add%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.AddRange%2A> methods.

To remove a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> that you have previously added, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Remove%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.RemoveAt%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Clear%2A> methods.
The indexed location within the collection to insert the toolbar button.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> to insert.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.
`true` if the collection is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> with the specified key from the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection>.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Item%2A> returns `null`.
The name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> to retrieve.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> whose <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton.Name"></xref> property matches the specified key.
Gets or sets the toolbar button at the specified indexed location in the toolbar button collection.

To assign <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> controls to a specific location, or to retrieve them from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection>, you can reference the collection object with a specific index value.
The index value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection> is a zero-based index.
The indexed location of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> in the collection.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> that represents the toolbar button at the specified indexed location.
The index value is `null`.
The index value is less than zero.
-or-
The index value is greater than the number of buttons in the collection, and the collection of buttons is not `null`.
Removes a given button from the toolbar button collection.

To remove toolbar buttons from the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.RemoveAt%2A>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Clear%2A> methods.

To add new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> objects to the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.AddRange%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Insert%2A> methods.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> to remove from the collection.
Removes a given button from the toolbar button collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Remove%2A> method removes the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> at the specified location in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection>.
If you want to remove all <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> controls from the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection.Clear%2A> method.
The indexed location of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> in the collection.
The index value is less than 0, or it is greater than the number of buttons in the collection.
Removes the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> with the specified key from the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection>.
The name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> to remove from the collection.
Copies the elements of the <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> to an <xref href="System.Array"></xref>, starting at a particular <xref href="System.Array"></xref> index.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection> is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
The one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref> that is the destination of the elements copied from <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Array"></xref> must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in dest at which copying begins.
Gets a value indicating whether access to the collection is synchronized (thread safe).
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection> is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
`false` in all cases.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection of buttons.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection> is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
Adds the specified toolbar button to the end of the toolbar button collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection> is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> to be added after all existing buttons.
The zero-based index value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> added to the collection.
button is not a .
Determines whether the collection contains a specific value.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection> is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The item to locate in the collection.
`true` if the item is found in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Determines the index of a specific item in the collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection> is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The item to locate in the collection.
The index of button if found in the list; otherwise, -1.
Inserts an existing toolbar button in the toolbar button collection at the specified location.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection> is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The indexed location within the collection to insert the toolbar button.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolBarButton"></xref> to insert.
button is not a .
Gets a value indicating whether the collection has a fixed size.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection> is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
`false` in all cases.
Gets or sets the item at a specified index.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection> is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index of the element to get or set.
The element at the specified index.
Removes the first occurrence of an item from the collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolBar.ToolBarButtonCollection> is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to remove from the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
